qas.question: Are there many flights to burkina faso?

answers.text: flights to and from Burkina Faso remain limited.

qas.question: How many days in advance should i test prior to landing in burkina faso?

answers.text: no more than 5 days prior to entry

qas.question: What happens if i do not test before landing in burkina faso?

answers.text: identity documents temporarily confiscated by the authorities and will be required to take a rapid diagnostic test

paragraphs.context:
Commercial flights to and from Burkina Faso remain limited. Check with your travel company for the latest information. Land and sea borders remain closed until further notice.
\nAll international travellers will need to present a negative COVID 19 PCR test certificate dated no more than 5 days prior to arrival in Burkina Faso.
\nPassengers arriving in Burkina Faso without a negative PCR test dated no more than 5 days prior to entry will have their identity documents temporarily confiscated by the authorities and will be required to take a rapid diagnostic test (RDT) and a PCR test. Confiscated identity documents will be returned after verification of payment for the tests. In the event of a positive RDT test, travellers will be placed in quarantine at their own expense at a government allocated hotel for 72 hours while awaiting the results of the PCR test. RDT and PCR tests are free for children under 6 years old.
